lines.text:
[to the Indian chiefs]
Now, remember, you're Indians.

[to Ashton]
No member of the party has the right to deny he is not a candidate unless he is a candidate.

[to Houlihan]
Owning a nice little diary is like owning a nice little atom bomb. Even if you don't do anything with it, it's a comfort to know it's there.

[to Poppy]
You can't go around quoting politicians correctly! That's dirty journalism and you know it!
There's one thing you can't say about me, Fred, I have never put one man or woman on the public payroll who was not my own blood kin-or Mrs. Ashton's, anyway.
